ingredients.name: Sichuan Peppercorn
ingredients.description: The tongue-numbing citrus-scented berry of a Chinese prickly ash tree.
facts: Native to Sichuan Province, China
Cultivated throughout Asia
Pairs well with citrus, ginger, and anything in the anise family

ingredients.name: Cayenne
ingredients.description: The all-purpose hot chili commonly found in Western hot sauce.
facts: Native to French Guiana, Central and South America
Cultivated in Mexico, Africa, India, and Louisiana
Cayenne is a medium to high-heat chili with sweet-and-sour notes, dusty overtones, and a great orange color

ingredients.name: Monosodium Glutamate
ingredients.description: A flavor enhancer with an umami taste that intensifies the meaty, savory flavor of food
facts: MSG was first prepared in 1908 by Japanese biochemist Kikunae Ikeda, who was trying to isolate and duplicate the savory taste of kombu

ingredients.name: Popping Corn
ingredients.description: A variety of corn kernel which expands and puffs up when heated.
facts: Popcorn is one of the six major types of corn
The others are dent corn, pod corn, flour corn, flint corn, and sweet corn
The outer hull pops at approximately 135 psi and 180 C

ingredients.name: Chia Seeds
ingredients.description: A mild-flavored seed with exciting hydrophilic behaviour.
facts: Native to Mexico and the Southwestern United States
Cultivated throughout Central and South America
Chia seeds absorb up to 12 times their weight in liquid when soaked, and develop a mucilaginous coating
Exceptionally good at getting stuck in the spaces between your teeth

ingredients.name: Powdered Sugar
ingredients.description: A mix of finely ground sugar and cornstarch, designed to dissolve quickly and without caking
facts: Before sugar was widely available in granulated form, it came in cakes or cones
Chefs would then grate it to the desired size
Sugar cane is thousands of years old, while sugar beets were only developer in the mid 18th century in Prussia

ingredients.name: Milk Powder
ingredients.description: A shelf-stable, lightweight form of milk often used in candy, baked goods, and infant formula.
facts: Partially drying milk gives evaporated milk, also known as unsweetened condensed milk
The flavors and fat content in the original milk significantly impact the flavor of the powder; so does the drying method

ingredients.name: Currants
ingredients.description: The dried berries of the Black Corinth grape, often used in British cuisine.
facts: They are not related to black, red, or white currants
White Corinth grapes are often marketed as Champagne Grapes in the United States
Toxic to dogs
The British imported them as a sweetener before sugar was widely available

ingredients.name: Barberries
ingredients.description: A small, sharply-flavored sour fruit commonly used in Persian cooking.
facts: Zereshk in Persian
Grows in the wild in Europe and West Asia
Two related species are found in Argentina and Chile
The stem, root, and bark can be used to make a yellow dye

ingredients.name: Shredded Coconut
ingredients.description: The sweet meat of the coconut seed, which has been shredded and then dried
facts: Every part of the coconut has a use, from the inside of the fruit to the fibrous husks to their leaves and trunks
If you were stuck on a deserted island, a coconut tree would be an excellent resource!

ingredients.name: Sunflower Seeds
ingredients.description: The hulled seed of the sunflower, often used as a carrier for salt and flavor
facts: Did you know you can buy pickle flavored sunflower seeds?
Sunflowers tilt during the day to face the sun, but stop when they begin blooming

ingredients.name: Cloves
ingredients.description: A powerfully scented dried flower bud
facts: A member of the myrtle family
The Dutch monopolized the trade of cloves from the seventeenth century on
In the late 1700s a Frenchman named Pierre Poivre brought stolen clove seedlings to France (and then to Zanzibar) and set up competition with the Dutch

ingredients.name: Ginger
ingredients.description: A fragrant, peppery spice made from a knobby rhizome
facts: The spicy compound in ginger is called gingerol
Cultivated in India, China, Japan, Indonesia, Nigeria, Jamaica, and various islands of the West Indies
Native to China

ingredients.name: Star Anise
ingredients.description: A sweet, licorice-scented spice made from distinct eight-pointed fruits
facts: Native to China and Vietnam

ingredients.name: Cinnamon
ingredients.description: Warm spices made from the barks of young tree stems
facts: The trees are grown for multiple years, then chopped down to stumps that push up bushy new shoots from the base
After the rainy season these shoots are cut
The outer bark is scraped off and discarded, and the inner bark carefully pulled off into rolls
